name: Kepler-244
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-244 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-244 is a star with 0.6950000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8 times its radius. It is located 3482.11 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-244 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-244 b

Kepler-244 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.31 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-244.

The mass of Kepler-244 b is 10.98 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-244 b is 2.76 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-244 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-244 c

Kepler-244 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.77 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-244.

The mass of Kepler-244 c is 5.40 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-244 c is 2.05 that of Earth. At 5.40 Earth masses, Kepler-244 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-244 d

Kepler-244 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.05 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-244.

The mass of Kepler-244 d is 7.17 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-244 d is 2.31 that of Earth. At 7.17 Earth masses, Kepler-244 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-244, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
